EHR (Electronic Health Record)
Purpose: Authoritative digital repository of a patient’s clinical history and care activities.
Core Modules & Functions:
• Clinical Documentation: Progress notes, flowsheets, care plans, allergy and medication reconciliation • Order Entry: Computerized Provider Order Entry (CPOE) for labs, meds, imaging, consults • Decision Support: Alerts for drug interactions, sepsis screening, preventive care reminders • Results Management: Lab and diagnostic result display, longitudinal trends, provider annotations • Patient Engagement: Secure portal for telehealth visits, messaging, appointment reminders, educational materials
Architecture & Integration:
• Data model centered on a longitudinal patient record that services an analytical data warehouse for population health • Exposes FHIR APIs for third-party apps (e.g., mobile medication adherence tools) • Bi-directional interfaces with pharmacy systems, CPOE, CDS engines, and billing subsystems
Example Software Highlights:
• Epic EHR: Hyperspace UI with SmartForms and SmartLinks, FHIR-based App Orchard ecosystem, predictive analytics modules • Meditech Expanse: Web-native platform, integrated patient portal, open APIs for seamless interoperability
